intro: Ranunculus bayerae, commonly known as the Bavarian buttercup, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange, with five to eight petals. The plant features a hairy stem and trifoliate leaves, which are deeply lobed and have a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Ranunculus bayerae is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
